ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yeah, some of their changes are stupid, though others are brilliant. Most of the balancing falls on the stupid side, though. But some, like the nerfing
ygData.messageBody:
--- EQCheats@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> DUe to the frequent changes sony/varent has induced into this game
> such as revamping some perfectly fine zones and make them harder than
> orginaly, and swiping c3 and even c2 from our collective grasp, my
> famley members who play this game will be writing sony and they will
> shortly and most likely

Yeah, some of their changes are stupid, though others are brilliant. Most of
the "balancing" falls on the stupid side, though.

But some, like the nerfing of Uber buffs on lowbies, is because almost
everyone at SOE plays PvP. While I absolutely hate being unable to get KEI (I
never played without it on a blue server, from the first moment I can get to
Nexus alive on up, starting at first level), PotG and such, on PvP servers
(where I play a lot now) it's a wonderful blessing, as the cowardly Player
Killers can't buff themselves up to invulnerability for the times they're
hanging around zonelines murdering everyone who comes through.

They shouldn't have nerfed Uber spells, but they almost certainly just got
fed up with being butchered by 16th level PKers with 2000 HP and unlimited
mana.

> be quiting this game, which in effect may lead to my defection as
> well due to the incressing dificulty of this so call "class balancing"
> now mind you this is total horse shit on sonys part, and they are
> taking all the fun and adventur out of this game by making every
> thing totaly impossible and un reachable, now i know not every one
> feels like this but not every one is a druid who with out c3 can
> cast no more that 3 spells with out haveing to sit for 20 minets and
> meddititing for example

They WANT you to quit, but you're not supposed to do it for another few
months, until EQ2 comes out. They are, in essence, giving way too much fuel
to the EverQuest fire, so that it will burn really bright until November (or
whatever the current release date), then go out.

> What im asking my fellow everquest players and there friends is for
> there suport in the effort we are trying to get sony to see, that
> they are systematicly desimating a game that once was fun and
> enjoyable. Once this letter is writin i will have it in
> the forums were i can with sonys email which we have directed these

I think they'll rub their hands together in glee.

> coments.We would appriciate the suport of our fellow gamers and

Spellcheck those complaints you send to them, it'll improve their crediblity.
Seriously.
